metadata.title: The impact of unplanned school closure on children's social contact: Rapid evidence review

abstract.original_text: Emergency school closures are often used as public health interventions during infectious disease outbreaks in an attempt to minimise the spread of infection. However, if children continue to mix with others outside the home during the closures, these measures are unlikely to be effective.

abstract.original_text: This review aimed to summarise existing literature on children's activities and contacts made outside the home during unplanned school closures.
